p: To incorporate potential impacts of serial correlation, we tested whether seasonally averaged T and P are significantly serially correlated in time. Figure S7 shows that for most regions on land and most models, T and P are not significantly correlated at lag 1 ( P < 0.05). For some tropical areas, including the Amazon, Congo, and Indonesia, most models show significant serial correlation at lag 1 for T. However, this is not the case for P. Hence, we concluded that serial correlation should not have a significant impact on the assessment of bivariate extremes. All the remaining analyses were based on land data only.
